alert.note: Alert for City of Radford; Montgomery; Pulaski (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 26 at 8:17PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Virginia, including the following counties and independent city, City of Radford, Montgomery and Pulaski. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Stream flows may be elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 805 PM EDT, Automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Amounts upwards of 2 inches have been reported in Elliston and parts of the Ellett valley in Montgomery County. Amounts close to 2 inches have been measured in the Radford area near Fairlawn. Amounts of around 1.5 inches have been observed in Newbern, which is south of Dublin. Minor flooding is ongoing or has already occurred in these areas of the county. - The heaviest rain has come to an end. The thunderstorms have generally weakened and are dissipating. Even though the rain has ended, runoff will continue, and stream levels may be elevated or still rising. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Now that it is getting dark, be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
